name: Victoria Guest House

reviews.text: This is the best game in town. I discovered it on a walking tour while I was staying at a place in Beach Haven that was very uncomfortable to say the least. The breakfasts are great, the pool is super. In fact, it is the only B&B that has a pool. Also the owners do not take children under 12. Therefore you don't have the pool dominated by a bunch of undisciplined, noisy brats.
reviews.title: LBI getaway

reviews.text: My daughter and I have stayed at the Victoria Guest House many times. It is charming and always immaculate. The breakfasts are delicious. The rooms are very comfortable. There is a very nice pool. There are bikes, beach chairs, outdoor showers; everything you need for a
reviews.title: Always our favorite place to stay at LBI

reviews.text: really comfortable and fun stay. Judy and John are very friendly and always helpful. Can't say enough good things about this B&B.
reviews.title: Victoria Guest House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is my 2nd year staying at the Victoria Guest House during my annual end-of-summer trip to Long Beach Island. The Inn is immaculate, comfortable, charming, quiet, and in a great location. Judy & John go out of their way to be sure you have everything you need. I would (and do!) recommend this to anyone for the perfect beach vacation accommodations.
reviews.title: Lovely Stay
Great stay at the Victoria Guest House!!!
reviews.text: My husband and I just stayed at this lovely B & B for 3 nights. We had room #2 in the second house that we requested after reading reviews here. The room was cozy and comfortable...it had a king size bed, flatscreen tv, wifi, bath & shower and (the best part) a second floor porch with wicker furniture overlooking the pool in the back. The B&B owners make you feel at home and are as accommodating as possible. A full breakfast with more choices than I've ever seen (except at a large hotel buffet) are available every morning with seating on the front porch. The B&B itself is a block from this beautiful NJ beac and bikes and chairs as well as a beach bag and towels are provided. Lots of good restaurants to choose from within walking distance...we never moved our car all weekend! Overall, thumbs up...highly recommend.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In town for a three day wedding weekend at an adjacent area hotel, Victoria Guest House accommodated all of our needs for a lovely and memorable stay.
reviews.title: Centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked Room 5, Victoria Guest House II (next door) via internet which was a relatively seamless process. Their user-friendly website adequately explained directions, amenities, what to expect, etc. The hosts were very gracious in expecting our late-night arrival from 9 hours away. The lodging itself is divided between two homes adjacent to each other. The main house is where majority of the activity occurs. We found Victoria II to be more quiet and relaxing. Accommodations are well kept and having a private bathroom was a nice feature. Our bedspread did have an odd looking stain on it which didn't detract from our experience, but it was noticeable upon initial entry. We were impressed with how ambient sound was muffled from other guests, stairs, street, etc. which led to a relatively good night's sleep. However, the outdated A/C unit left much to be desired, kicking on and off regularly. It took a night to get used to, but did keep us cool from the trailing summer humidity.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable!

reviews.text: Breakfast options ranged from pancakes, waffles, eggs, sausage, and other sweet and salty homemade treats served very elegantly in a casual and social setting with other guests. We absolutely enjoyed the availability of bicycles for use to trample around the Jersey Shore area. Victoria Guest House is centrally located with numerous restaurants, a pharmacy, bars, etc. all within walking and bicycling distance. The beach is merely a stone's throw away and, once again, the hosts make beach passes available AND free to all guests.
reviews.title: Ahhhhhhhhh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Though the online reservation process is seamless, do pay close attention to the mail-in deposit directions. Reservations are not secured unless a deposit is mailed in the form of a check (which we hope in the future will be changed to an online payment process). We felt that $205 (off-season rate) was adequate for the accommodation, food, location, and amenities.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay/Great Location/Too $$$

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The highlight of our stay? Tie between the free availability of beach cruiser bikes and the coconut cherry cobbler (oh my goodness TO DIE FOR) ... ok, so the cobbler has the slight edge.
reviews.title: Wonderful get-away!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just went on our baby-moon at the Victoria guest house. The house itself is very beautiful. It is a very well maintained Victorian beach house with classic wooden shingles and pitched roofs. We stayed in the cottage and found it to be quiet and charming. Though the rooms maintained a Victorian style and decor, there were modern conveniences like wi-fi there. The house and grounds are very well kept. We went on a cooler weekend, so it was a treat to dip into the heated pool. There were lots of other great amenities too. There was a fridge full of bottled water to take to the beach. The beach chairs and towels provided were great; the chairs were especially nice featuring backpack-style carrying straps, insulated pockets for cool drinks and padded neck rests. There was a fantastic breakfast spread every morning. I haven't ever had a free breakfast before at any hotel like the one provided at the Victoria. We had the option of coffee, tea, milk, orange juice, or milk to drink and then there were cereals, bagels, muffins, croissants, homemade waffles, a variety of coffee cakes, yogurts, etc to eat. All tasted fantastic. I particularly enjoyed the homemade monkey bread, which I told the owner, Judy; the proprietress nicely printed out a copy of the recipe and passed it along to us before leaving. The bikes provided for jaunting around were really cute and convenient. Everyone staying there was extremely friendly. The owners work hard to maintain a quiet and relaxing place. It made the whole stay very relaxing. It was definitely one of the better vacations I have been on in recent years. I highly recommend it!
reviews.title: Great little bed and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Victoria Guest House exceeded our expectations for a much needed, relaxing get-away. The innkeepers go above and beyond to make you feel welcome. Breakfast is "continental-plus". The plus is a home-made entree which differs each morning. Quiche, sausage casserole, french toast, etc. Fresh fruit and home made breads/pastries are plentiful. Coffee and tea are available 24/7. There is a full size refrigerator in each guest house. Bottled water is provided. Beach chairs/passes/bikes/beach towels/beach bags are all included. They recommended great dining options. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Great DVD movie and book collection available at your disposal. Pool was heated to 80 degrees and pristine. Located on very quiet street with friendly locals. Definitely will be going back again.
reviews.title: Relaxing B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I have been vacationing on LBI for over 25 years and we just found our new best place to stay -- the Victoria Guest House in Beach Haven. Everything about the Victoria Guest House is first class, from the beautiful and comfortable rooms to the extraordinary amenities offered to all guests, including bicycles, beach chairs, towels for the beach, even cold water to take with you. I would be remiss if I did not also mention the wonderful breakfast selection and friendly owners (John & Judy) who go out of their way to make sure your stay is enjoyable. We knew the Victoria Guest House was going to be different when we called the day before our arrival to make sure of check-in time. Judy told by wife that since no one is occupying the room we'll be staying in we can "check-in" whenever we arrive...oh and if we can arrive before 10:00 AM we are welcome to enjoy breakfast. Never had that happen before. The Victoria Guest House will be closing for the winter at the end of September. The wife and I are going to try to fit a quick trip back for a few days before the season ends. Great place to stay!!
reviews.title: How could we have missed this great B & B (Victoria Guest House)

reviews.text: If you want beautiful surroundings, well kept rooms, and cleanliness along with the friendly owners and the smell of delicious baked goods.....this is the only place to stay!
reviews.title: Victoria Guest House is a Diamond by the Shore

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been visiting for at least 4 years now and it just gets better each time! They supply bikes, towels, beach chairs and good company! Enjoy!
reviews.title: A Great Experience!

reviews.text: The facilities and ownership/management lived up or exceeded all compliments we had read about them. The location is excellent, the facilities are very clean and well-maintained, and the hosts are persons with a breadth of knowledge and experience who really "reach out" to ensure all guests are comfortable and well-informed regarding all critical aspects pertaining to holidaying on the island. Considering we went during the "peak of the season" the facilities were somewhat pricey, but the hosts deliver. The conveniences such as availability of good bicycles etc without any additional charges are a big plus. We have already recommended the location to our friends and will definitely consider staying there again during our next visit to LBI.
reviews.title: Our stay at Victoria Guest House

reviews.text: I did my research and the Victoria Guest House had the most bang for your buck in a B&B on LBI. It is comfortable, charming, quiet and John and Judy are so welcoming. It is one block from the beach and located in the best part of Beach Haven. They provide bikes, badges, beach chairs and towels...And, it has a pool!!!! I will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Great in-season value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you have to interrupt the summer help, who is busy finger picking through the breakfast buffet fruit plate popping bits of melon into her mouth to get her to bring it back to the buffet, and your $300 a night third floor room has a plastic shower stall and generic Dial soap, a creaky semi-soft bed and rattling inefficient air conditioner, you have to wonder what kind of glamouring the owners are doing to their guests to get these reviews. It’s amazing what people will put up with to be a block and a half from the beach. See my other reviews for b&b’s that get it right. Gratefully, we’re off to one of them next week.
reviews.title: Underwelled

reviews.text: We try to stay at least once a year, it's been about 8 years now and year after year the property is always well kept. The host and hostess are really friendly people. We love going to the beach and then heading back for a swim in the pool. We enjoy breakfast on the porch every morning and spend our evenings after dinner there as well. Although there's plenty of good food and shopping, it's still a "beach town" .
reviews.title: Inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at this beautiful Inn. John and Judy are truly wonderful people who have thought of everything to make your stay a memorable one. The breakfasts were delicious and plentiful. Fresh fruit and baked goods always. There are two lovely Victorian homes next to each other with a carriage house between them. Your a block from the beach and close to restaurants and shopping. Rooms are clean, cozy and very comfortable with lovely antique furniture. A great heated pool with nice seating is a plus. Bikes, beach chairs, badges, towels, a tote bag and plenty of cold water, coffee or tea is available. You will meet such wonderful people staying here. Once you come here you will be planning your next visit! Thanks again Judy and John for another great weekend!
reviews.title: Exceptional!

aka: Victoria Guest House Long Beach Island, NJ - Beach Haven
description: At the Victoria Guest House Bed and Breakfast, step back in time to the charm of the late nineteenth century. Our gracious New Jersey Shore bed and breakfast guest houses offer B&B lodging with the warmth of a friendly, family atmosphere and the refreshing feeling of a "Home away from Home." Our inn is conveniently located in the heart of beautiful Beach Haven, NJ, on Long Beach Island and only a few steps from the Atlantic Ocean.
